analyzed: slob dpon / bla na med pa'i ye shes thob par bgyi ba'i slad du rig pa'i rgyal po bdag la stsal du gsol /
translated: “Master, please grant me the king of knowledge in order to attain unsurpassed wisdom.

original: byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du bgyi'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi snying po la gnas kyi bar du bgyi'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: I will do so until I reach the essence of awakening.”

original: slob dpon gyis kyang thams cad du snying rje dang ldan pas ser sna med par byas la slob ma de la sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang thams cad du snying rje dang ldan pas ser sna med par byas la slob ma de la sbyin par bya'o //
translated: The master, also, having become free of stinginess through compassion, should give it to the disciple.

original: de ltar rig sngags dang / dam tshig mnos nas ji skad bstan pa lta bu'i sa phyogs rnams su de dang mthun pa'i cha byad du bsgyur la ri'i rtse mo'am /
analyzed: de ltar rig sngags dang / dam tshig mnos nas ji skad bstan pa lta bu'i sa phyogs rnams su de dang mthun pa'i cha byad du bsgyur la ri'i rtse mo'am /
translated: Having thus taken up the vidyā-mantra and the samaya, one should transform into the corresponding guise in places that accord with the teachings, such as the peak of a mountain,

original: 'bab chu'i ngogs sam /
analyzed: 'bab chu'i ngogs sam /
translated: the bank of a river,

original: nags khrod dam /
analyzed: nags khrod dam /
translated: a forest grove,

original: chu mig gi dngo 'am /🔽yid du 'ong ba dben pa der zas dkar gsum za ba'am /
analyzed: chu mig gi dngo 'am / yid du 'ong ba dben pa der zas dkar gsum za ba'am /
translated: the source of a spring,🔽or a delightful solitary place.

original: 'o ma btung zhing lan sa ya bzlas brjod byas na sngar spyad pa byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'o ma btung zhing lan sa ya bzlas brjod byas na sngar spyad pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one eats the three white foods or drinks milk and recites the mantra ten million times, one will have completed the preliminary practice.

original: de nas ral gri 'am; rdo rje'am /🔽mdung thung ngam /🔽be con nam /
analyzed: de nas ral gri 'am; rdo rje'am / mdung thung ngam / be con nam /
translated: Then, one should take a sword, a vajra,🔽a spear,🔽a club,

original: mdung rtse gsum pa'am /
analyzed: mdung rtse gsum pa'am /
translated: a trident,

original: lcags sna gsum gyi 'khor lo blangs la ba'i rnam lngas bkrus te ba lang gi lci ba'i phung po'i steng du gzhag la rdo rje drag po chen po'i snying pos bsrung bar bya'o //
analyzed: lcags sna gsum gyi 'khor lo blangs la ba'i rnam lngas bkrus te ba lang gi lci ba'i phung po'i steng du gzhag la rdo rje drag po chen po'i snying pos bsrung bar bya'o //
translated: or a wheel made of the three types of iron, wash it with the five products of the cow, place it on a heap of cow dung, and protect it with the essence mantra of Great Wrathful Vajra.

original: de nas zla ba tshes nas bzung ste nya'i bar du bzlas brjod bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zla ba tshes nas bzung ste nya'i bar du bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: Then, starting from the first day of the waxing moon, one should recite the mantra until the full moon.

original: de nas gang yang rung ba zhig blangs la spos chus bkrus te /
analyzed: de nas gang yang rung ba zhig blangs la spos chus bkrus te /
translated: Then, having taken up any one of them, wash it with perfumed water.

original: ba lang gi lci bas la ma lhung bas dkyil 'khor bskus la snga ma bzhin du dkyil 'khor bris te /
analyzed: ba lang gi lci bas la ma lhung bas dkyil 'khor bskus la snga ma bzhin du dkyil 'khor bris te /
translated: Anoint the maṇḍala with cow dung that has not fallen on the ground, and draw the maṇḍala as before.

original: ci 'byor pas mchod la shing aa shvattha'i lo ma'i steng du gzhag la /
analyzed: ci 'byor pas mchod la shing aa shvattha'i lo ma'i steng du gzhag la /
translated: Make offerings with whatever you can afford, and place it on an aśvattha leaf.

original: @133b mtshan thog thag bzlas brjod byas na /
analyzed: @133b mtshan thog thag bzlas brjod byas na /
translated: Recite the mantra all night.

original: nam phyed dam /
analyzed: nam phyed dam /
translated: At midnight

original: nyi ma 'char kar nges par 'bar zhing rig sngags 'chang thams cad 'dus te /
analyzed: nyi ma 'char kar nges par 'bar zhing rig sngags 'chang thams cad 'dus te /
translated: or at sunrise, it will definitely blaze. All the vidyādharas will gather.

original: de dag gis bsod nams ji lta ba bzhin du dbang bskur nas rig sngags 'chang du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis bsod nams ji lta ba bzhin du dbang bskur nas rig sngags 'chang du 'gyur te /
translated: They will confer empowerment according to one’s merit and one will become a vidyādhara.🔽One will assume the form one desires, travel to many world systems, and make offerings to all tathāgatas.

original: 'dod pa'i gzugs 'chang ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams du mar rgyu ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa byed par 'gyur ro; ;ci ste ma grub la brtul zhugs ma nyams na de bzhin du lan gsum du bsgrub pa byas na /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i gzugs 'chang ba dang / 'jig rten gyi khams du mar rgyu ba dang / de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad la mchod pa byed par 'gyur ro; ;ci ste ma grub la brtul zhugs ma nyams na de bzhin du lan gsum du bsgrub pa byas na /
translated: If one is not successful, and one’s observances are not impaired, one should perform the sādhana three times in the same way.

original: mtshams med pa'i las byas pas kyang nges par 'grub bo //
analyzed: mtshams med pa'i las byas pas kyang nges par 'grub bo //
translated: One who has committed the five acts of immediate retribution will certainly accomplish it.

original: rtag tu bzlas brjod byas na tshe ring bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu bzlas brjod byas na tshe ring bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one always recites it, one will have a long life.

original: sman la bzlas brjod byas te 'thungs na nad med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sman la bzlas brjod byas te 'thungs na nad med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one drinks medicine over which the mantra has been recited, one will be free from illness.

original: mar la sngags kyis btab te /🔽zan za kar 'thungs na lo khyud 'khor du lus brtan par 'gyur ro; ;bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gzugs kyi mdun du mig btsums te /
analyzed: mar la sngags kyis btab te / zan za kar 'thungs na lo khyud 'khor du lus brtan par 'gyur ro; ;bcom ldan 'das kyi sku gzugs kyi mdun du mig btsums te /
translated: One should anoint ghee with the mantra🔽and drink it while eating food; one’s body will be firm for a year.

original: lan stong rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gzugs kyis dge ba dang / mi dge ba brjod do //
analyzed: lan stong rtsa brgyad bzlas brjod byas na de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku'i gzugs kyis dge ba dang / mi dge ba brjod do //
translated: If one recites it one thousand and eight times in front of an image of the Blessed One with one’s eyes closed, the image of the Tathāgata’s body will declare what is virtuous and nonvirtuous.

original: de bzhin du rna ba bkab ste bzlas brjod byas na yang thams cad thos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba bkab ste bzlas brjod byas na yang thams cad thos par 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, if one recites it while covering one’s ears, one will hear everything.

original: nyal kar mal du zhugs la mig la lan brgya rtsa brgyad sngags te nyal na snang bar 'gyur zhing thams cad mthong ste /
analyzed: nyal kar mal du zhugs la mig la lan brgya rtsa brgyad sngags te nyal na snang bar 'gyur zhing thams cad mthong ste /
translated: If one recites the mantra one hundred and eight times over one’s eyes and goes to bed, one will see everything in one’s dreams.

original: nyin mo ji lta ba ltar mtshan mo yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: nyin mo ji lta ba ltar mtshan mo yang de bzhin no //
translated: It will be the same at night as it is during the day.

original: so shing la lan gcig sngags te 'chos na ma bslangs bar zas rnyed do //🔽lig bu mig @134a *//
analyzed: so shing la lan gcig sngags te 'chos na ma bslangs bar zas rnyed do // lig bu mig @134a *//
translated: If one chews a tooth stick once enchanted, one will obtain food without having to beg.

original: gam / gi wang la lan gcig sngags te mig la bskus na skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gam / gi wang la lan gcig sngags te mig la bskus na skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one anoints one's eyes once with bhrnggaraja or gorocana enchanted once, all people will be pleased.

original: spos la bzlas brjod byas te bskus na /
analyzed: spos la bzlas brjod byas te bskus na /
translated: If one anoints oneself with incense enchanted,

original: gang dag gis dri tshor ba de dag dbang du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang dag gis dri tshor ba de dag dbang du 'gyur ro //
translated: those who smell the scent will be enthralled.

original: dgra mthong na phyag rgyas bcings la lan cig brjod na dgra dang bral bar 'gyur ro //🔽spos dang / me tog la sogs pa la sngags kyis lan cig btab te /
analyzed: dgra mthong na phyag rgyas bcings la lan cig brjod na dgra dang bral bar 'gyur ro // spos dang / me tog la sogs pa la sngags kyis lan cig btab te /
translated: If one sees an enemy and binds him with the seal, saying the mantra once, one will be free from the enemy.

original: gang la byin pa de dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la byin pa de dbang du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one gives to someone incense, flowers, and so on, enchanted once with the mantra, he will be enthralled.

original: ci ste g-yul ngor 'jug par 'dod na skyes bu bcing ba byas la zhugs na g-yul ngor rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ci ste g-yul ngor 'jug par 'dod na skyes bu bcing ba byas la zhugs na g-yul ngor rgyal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one wishes to enter into battle, one should bind the man and enter; one will be victorious in battle.

original: ci ste dmag rengs par bya bar 'dod na /
analyzed: ci ste dmag rengs par bya bar 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to paralyze the army,

original: be kangka ta'i shing gi me bus la gru tshal gyi yam sreg shing gis lan khri sbyin sreg byas na dmag rengs par byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: be kangka ta'i shing gi me bus la gru tshal gyi yam sreg shing gis lan khri sbyin sreg byas na dmag rengs par byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one lights a fire with the wood of the bīkaṅkata tree and offers ten thousand oblations of agaru wood, one will bind the army.

original: gnod pa thams cad la mngar gsum gyi sreg blugs lan sum khri sbyin sreg byas na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnod pa thams cad la mngar gsum gyi sreg blugs lan sum khri sbyin sreg byas na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers thirty thousand oblations of the three sweet things, all harm will be pacified.

original: thal bas ni rdzi char gcod do //
analyzed: thal bas ni rdzi char gcod do //
translated: By means of the ashes, one can stop hail.

original: shing bu'am / mtshon gyis ni lce 'bab pa bzlog go /
analyzed: shing bu'am / mtshon gyis ni lce 'bab pa bzlog go /
translated: By means of a stick or a weapon, one can avert lightning.

original: skud pa sngon pos ni 'byung po'i gdon zhi bar byed do //🔽gzugs byas la thal ba'am /
analyzed: skud pa sngon pos ni 'byung po'i gdon zhi bar byed do // gzugs byas la thal ba'am /
translated: By means of a blue thread, one can pacify the grahas of bhūtas.

original: shing ka ra b'i ra'i lcug mas sbyin sreg byas na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shing ka ra b'i ra'i lcug mas sbyin sreg byas na zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one makes an effigy and offers oblations of ashes or twigs of the karavīra tree, one will be pacified.

original: gdon chen po la yang de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: gdon chen po la yang de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: One should do the same for the great grahas.

original: byis pa gdon gyis zin na 'bras s'a lu btags pa las gzugs byas la ske tshe'i 'bru dang / lan tshva dang bsres te /
analyzed: byis pa gdon gyis zin na 'bras s'a lu btags pa las gzugs byas la ske tshe'i 'bru dang / lan tshva dang bsres te /
translated: If a child is seized by a graha, one should make an effigy from dough, and mix it with mustard seeds and salt,

original: phub @134b ma'i me bus pa'i nang du sbyin sreg byas na dus thams cad du ming tsam gyis gdon thams cad 'gros par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phub @134b ma'i me bus pa'i nang du sbyin sreg byas na dus thams cad du ming tsam gyis gdon thams cad 'gros par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one offers oblations in a fire of chaff, all the grahas will be paralyzed by merely one’s name.

original: rims kyis btab pa la lag pa g-yon pa la sngags kyis btab ste mgo la gzhag na rims nad sel to //
analyzed: rims kyis btab pa la lag pa g-yon pa la sngags kyis btab ste mgo la gzhag na rims nad sel to //
translated: “If one recites the mantra over one’s left hand and places it on the head of someone afflicted by a fever, the fever will be removed.

original: nad thams cad bsal bar 'dod na sman thams cad bsogs la ba ru ra'i shing gi me bus te lan nyi shu rtsa gcig sreg blugs sbyin sreg byas na /
analyzed: nad thams cad bsal bar 'dod na sman thams cad bsogs la ba ru ra'i shing gi me bus te lan nyi shu rtsa gcig sreg blugs sbyin sreg byas na /
translated: “If one wants to remove all illnesses, one should collect all the medicines, light a fire of cutch tree sticks, and offer twenty-one oblations.

original: de phyin chad nad thams cad sel to //
analyzed: de phyin chad nad thams cad sel to //
translated: From then on, all illnesses will be removed.

original: ci ste ri mo'i gzugs bsgrub par 'dod na ras skra med pa ma dras pa la snga ma bzhin du ri mo mkhan gso sbyong bzung ba la sbyin dang ma 'dres pa'i tshon rnams kyis rig pa'i rgyal po 'drir gzhug ste /

translated: “If one wants to perform the sādhana of the painting, one should commission a painter who observes the ritual fast, and who has not been involved in sexual intercourse, to paint the king of knowledge on a piece of clean cloth, without weft threads, as before.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis rnam par brgyan pa /
translated: He should be adorned with all the ornaments,

original: cod pan mgul la thogs pa /
analyzed: cod pan mgul la thogs pa /
translated: with a necklace around his neck,

analyzed: padma dkar po la 'dug pa; rgyal po chen po'i cha byad 'dzin //
translated: wearing the attire of a great king,

original: me lce 'bar ba'i phreng ba kun nas lang long du gyur pa /
analyzed: me lce 'bar ba'i phreng ba kun nas lang long du gyur pa /
translated: surrounded by a garland of blazing flames,

original: lag pa g-yon pa na rdo rje thogs pa /
analyzed: lag pa g-yon pa na rdo rje thogs pa /
translated: holding a vajra in his left hand,

original: g-yas pas dam pa sbyin pa /
analyzed: g-yas pas dam pa sbyin pa /
translated: granting boons with his right,

original: skyil mo krung du bzhugs pa /
analyzed: skyil mo krung du bzhugs pa /
translated: seated in the vajra posture,

original: zhal cung zad 'dzum pa /
analyzed: zhal cung zad 'dzum pa /
translated: with a slightly smiling face,

original: sgrub pa po la gzigs par bri'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa po la gzigs par bri'o //
translated: looking at the practitioner.

original: de'i 'og rol tu sgrub pa po lag na po phor thogs shing de'i gdong du blta ba la brtson pa /
analyzed: de'i 'og rol tu sgrub pa po lag na po phor thogs shing de'i gdong du blta ba la brtson pa /
translated: Below him, the practitioner should be drawn holding a water pot, gazing at his face,

analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa'i cha byad can pus mo btsugs pa bri'o //
translated: decked in proper attire, kneeling.

original: de'i mdun du lan sa ya bzlas brjod byas na snga ma bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mdun du lan sa ya bzlas brjod byas na snga ma bzhin du 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: In front of him, if one recites one million times, one will accomplish as before.

original: rig pa'i rgyal po spyir bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i rgyal po spyir bsgrub pa'o //
translated: This is the general accomplishment of the king of knowledge mantras.

original: @135a *// zhi ba'i blo gros /
analyzed: @135a *// zhi ba'i blo gros /
translated: Śāntimati,

analyzed: gzhan yang / lag na rdo rje'i bu smon lam chen po la dbang thob pa /
translated: furthermore, Vajrapāṇi's son, having attained mastery over great aspirations,

analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad dang mnyam pa nyid du gnas pa rnams kyi spyi'i bsgrub pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the general practice of all the tathāgatas who abide in sameness.

analyzed: snga ma bzhin du 'khor los bsgyur ba chen po'i cho gas gsang sngags gang yang rung ba mnos la /
translated: As before, having taken up any mantra through the rite of the great wheel-turning,

analyzed: ji skad brjod pa'i gnas kyi nang nas rgya mtshor 'bab pa'i chu ngogs su song la lan sa ya bzlas brjod byas na sngar spyad pa byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: one should go to the bank of a river that flows into the ocean in a place as previously described, and recite [the mantra] ten million times. One will have completed the preliminary practice.

original: de nas zla ba tshes nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de nas zla ba tshes nas bzung ste /
translated: Then, beginning on the first day of the waxing moon,

analyzed: rdzas gang bsgrub pa de blangs la zla ba nya'i bar du bzlas brjod bya'o //
translated: one should recite [the mantra] until the full moon, taking up whatever substances are to be accomplished.

original: de nas ci 'byor pas mchod de /
analyzed: de nas ci 'byor pas mchod de /
translated: Then, having made offerings with whatever one has,

analyzed: ba lang gi lci ba sa la ma lhung bas dkyil 'khor bskus la bsrung bar bya ste /
translated: one should anoint the maṇḍala with cow dung that has not fallen on the ground, and protect [oneself].

analyzed: gu gul gyi yam sreg shing zho dang / sbrang rtsi dang / mar las smyugs pas mtshan thog thag sbyin sreg byas na /
translated: Having performed oblations throughout the night with guggula incense smeared with curd, honey, and ghee,

original: nam phyed dam /
analyzed: nam phyed dam /
translated: at midnight

analyzed: nyi ma 'char kar nges par 'grub par 'gyur te rdzas de 'bar bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It will certainly be accomplished at sunrise, and that substance will blaze.

original: de blangs la rdo rje'i rigs su rdo rje gzhon nu'i lus 'thob bo //
analyzed: de blangs la rdo rje'i rigs su rdo rje gzhon nu'i lus 'thob bo //
translated: Taking that, in the Vajra family one will obtain the body of Vajrakumāra.

original: gzungs chen po thob bo //
analyzed: gzungs chen po thob bo //
translated: One will obtain the great dhāraṇīs.

original: 'dod na mchi'o //
analyzed: 'dod na mchi'o //
translated: If one wishes, one will fly.

analyzed: ci ste ma grub na yang las thams cad nus par 'gyur ro // shi 'phos na yang lcang lo can nam /

analyzed: longs spyod chen po'i khyim du skye bar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: rtag tu bzlas brjod byas na skye bo thams cad dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one always recites, one will be loved by all people.

analyzed: lag na rdo rje la blta zhing @135b bzlas brjod byas na sdig pa thams cad byang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites while looking at Vajrapāṇi, all one’s misdeeds will be purified.

original: lus thams cad la byab ba byas te mnyal na /
analyzed: lus thams cad la byab ba byas te mnyal na /
translated: If one goes to sleep after anointing one’s entire body with oil,

original: rmi lam na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mthong zhing de nyid du gzungs kyang 'thob po; ;zla ba spyang kis zin pa'i tshe ba ser mo ma smad spu mthun gyi mar blangs la zangs kyi snod du bcug ste /
analyzed: rmi lam na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams mthong zhing de nyid du gzungs kyang 'thob po; ;zla ba spyang kis zin pa'i tshe ba ser mo ma smad spu mthun gyi mar blangs la zangs kyi snod du bcug ste /
translated: When the moon is seized by Rāhu, one should take ghee from a tawny cow with a calf of the same color, put it in a copper vessel,

original: tsandan gyis dkyil 'khor byas la der gzhag ste /
analyzed: tsandan gyis dkyil 'khor byas la der gzhag ste /
translated: make a maṇḍala with sandalwood, and place it there.

original: zla ba la mi blta bar dngos grub rnam pa gsum byung gi bar du bzlas brjod byas la de 'thungs na thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba la mi blta bar dngos grub rnam pa gsum byung gi bar du bzlas brjod byas la de 'thungs na thos pa 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Without looking at the moon, one should recite until the three types of accomplishments occur. If one drinks it, one will retain what one hears.

original: 'bar na nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'bar na nam mkha' la 'gro bar 'gyur ro //

translated: If one wishes for good fortune, one should offer salt oblations for twenty-one days, and one will become the most fortunate of all two-legged and four-legged creatures.

analyzed: nyi ma 'gyur ba'i tshe lan sum 'bum bzlas brjod byas na //
